DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if there is a difference on the penetration of betadine 5% when using lidocaine 2% jelly versus topical tetracaine 0.5% in topical cataract surgery. This will be assessed comparing bacterial colony count and species by taking swabs from the eye surface before and after the topical anesthesia has been administered.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Tetracaine 0.5% and Lidocaine 2% Jelly for Topical Phacoemulsification Cataract Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose of this research study is to show that using Lidocaine2% jelly before surgery as an anesthetic (keep you from feeling touch or pain) for cataract surgery does not block the antiseptic (cleans and kills germs) effect of Betadine5%.
DOC.criteria: greater or equal to 18 years old uni or bilateral visually significant cataracts hypersensitivity to betadine5%, topical tetracaine0.5%, or lidocaine2% jelly pregnancy
